column5: yeah right this showed up in my email box   Dear Winner,  We are pleased to inform you of the result of the just concluded annual final draws of UK. NATIONAL PROMO  in conjunction with the  MICROSOFT WORD E-MAIL MEGA JACKPOT LOTTERY  PROGRAMS held on the (15th June 2007).However your email was among the 5 Lucky winners who won £500,000 (Five Hundred Thousand Pounds Sterling) each from the  total payout,  the PROMOTION  and your  email was attached to ticket number: xxxxxx and ballot number: BT:xxxxxxxx/xx. The selection process was carried out through random selection in our computerized email selection  machine (TOPAZ) from a database of over 250,000 email addresses drawn from all the continents of the world. However no tickets were sold but all email addresses were assigned to different ticket  numbers for  representation and privacy.  Your fund has been deposited in an Your fund has been deposited in an escrow account with our affiliate bank here in UK, and insured  with your ticket number. As We hope with your prize, you will be  happy to promote the use of E-mail and the use of MS WORD Please note that to file for your claim you are to contact our Promotion manager with your full details such as Name and Address, Country Of   Residence, Phone number, Occupation, Age, Sex, Ticket Number and Ballot Number.  Name: Mr.Paul James Email:[email protected]  Accept my hearty congratulations once again!  Yours faithfully, Mrs. Rose Hills.   should I start spending the money now   hey I just had a thought ..would I have to enter a contest in order to win it.......................LOL anyone else get one of these  funny that  microsoft would use yahoo for mail when they are MSN and hot mail.....LOL
i get these scam emails all the time who want share their money with me. How nice of them!
I never even opened those emails, I must have been down a few millions...
You would think the guys from IBM would solve this problem.LOL
Five Hundred Thousand Pounds of Sterling what?
